Description: Handbrake is active when direction selected.
No speed feedback from external heatsink fans
Low Oil
Hydraulic Filter
Pump motor is not drawing sufficient current
Isolation fault detected between logic and power frame
Recommended Action: Check isolation between low and high voltage circuits

Description: No speed feedback from motor
Recommended Action: Check encoder wiring and speed measurement signal

Description: Tow mode has been activated
Recommended Action: Disable tow mode if not required

Description: Invalid steer sensor state
Pulsed enable signal not present, unable to enable bridge
Recommended Action: Check 1kHz pulsed enable signal is received

Description: Warning level throttle fault. Used for Renault Twizy

Throttle appears to be stuck. This fault will clear if throttle starts to
work again.

Throttle appears to be stuck. This fault will latch and can only be
cleared by repairing the throttle and recycling power.
Contactor driver over current
Recommended Action:
Ensure contactor doesn't exceed maximum current and check
contactor wiring

Description: Contactor driver not working
Contactor driver over temperature
Recommended Action:
Ensure contactor doesn't exceed maximum current and check
contactor wiring

Description: Contactor driver unable to achieve current target in current mode
Recommended Action: Ensure contactor driver current target is within range

Description: Contactor driver MOSFET short circuit detected

BDI remaining charge (0x2790,1) is less than BDI Warning level
(0x2C30,5)

BDI remaining charge (0x2790,1) is less than BDI Cutout level
(0x2C30,4)

Battery voltage (0x5100,1) is less than Under Voltage limit
(0x2C02,2) for longer than the protection delay (0x2C03,0)

Battery voltage (0x5100,1) is greater than Over Voltage limit
(0x2C01,2) for longer than the protection delay (0x2C03,0)

Capacitor voltage (0x5100,3) is greater than Over Voltage limit
(0x2C01,2) for longer than the protection delay (0x2C03,0)

Battery voltage (0x5100,1) is less than rated minimum voltage for controller for longer than 1s.
NOTE: This fault is sometimes seen at power down.

Battery voltage (0x5100,1) is greater than rated maximum voltage
for controller for longer than 1s.

Capacitor voltage (0x5100,3) is greater than rated maximum voltage
for controller for longer than 1s.
Motor control has entered low voltage cutback region.
Motor control has entered high voltage cutback region.
Low heatsink temperature (0x5100,4) has reduced power to motor
Recommended Action: Allow controller to warm up to normal operating temperature.

Description: High heatsink temperature (0x5100,4) has reduced power to motor
Recommended Action: Allow controller to cool down to normal operating temperature.

Description:
High measured (0x4600,3) or estimated (0x4602,8) motor
temperature has reduced power to motor
Recommended Action: Allow motor to cool down to normal operating temperature.

Description: Low Measured temperature has reached -30deg
Recommended Action: Check motor thermistor connection or allow motor to warm up.

Description: Controller is in pre-operational state
Recommended Action: If configured and ready for use, change state to operational.

Description: Controller has not received all configured RPDOs at power up
Recommended Action:
Check PDOs on all CANbus nodes are configured correctly and
match up.

Description:
One or more configured RPDOs not received with 3s at start up or
500ms during normal operation.
Recommended Action:
Check status of all nodes on CANbus. Check PDOs on all CANbus
nodes are configured correctly and match up.

Description: Encoder is not aligned properly.
Recommended Action: Ensure encoder offset is correctly set or re-align encoder

Description: SinCos Encoder Min Max Values are heading towards a voltage rail or converging together.
Recommended Action: Thermal or mechanical variation is causing the sincos encoder to deviate from the cold factory commissioned values.

Description:
Vehicle is operating in reduced power mode as some CAN
messages are not being received (Renault only)
Recommended Action: Check status of nodes on CANbus expected to be transmitting data

Description:
EMCY message received from non-Sevcon node and anonymous
EMCY level (0x2830,0) is set to 1.
Recommended Action: Check status of non-Sevcon nodes on CANbus

Description: Vehicle service next due time (0x2850,5) has expired. If supported Service driveability profile (0x2925) will activate.
Recommended Action: Service vehicle and reset service hours counter

Description:
Valid direction selected with operator not seated or operator is not
seated for a user configurable time in drive.
Recommended Action: Must be seated with switches inactive

Description:
Both the forward and reverse switches have been active
simultaneously for greater than 200 ms.
Recommended Action: Check vehicle wiring and reset switches

Description: FS1 active for user configurable delay (0x2914,2) without a direction selected.
Any drive switch active at power up.
FS1 active after a direction change and FS1 recycle function enabled (0x2914,1 bit 1)
Inch switch active along with any drive switch active (excluding inch switches), seat switch indicating operator present or handbrake switch active.
Vehicle overloaded
Scissor lift platform raised and tilted
Scissor lift pothole protection active
Recommended Action: Move vehicle out of pot hole.

Description: Traction function inhibited using traction inhibit switch (0x2137)
Vehicle changed from traction mode to pump mode (or vice versa) when direction selected
Aichi error code (0x3802,0) set to 0x02
Belly function has activated.
Fault with momentary direction selection switch
An issue has occurred with the PST unit
Throttle value (0x2620,0) is greater than 20% at power up.
Motor model current limit has cutback back below level allowed by cutback table (0x3805) on slope
Recommended Action: Check for temperature or voltage cutback condition and take appropriate action

Description: Controller has entered thermal or voltage cutback region
Recommended Action:
Check for temperature or voltage cutback condition and take
appropriate action

Description:
Thermal or voltage cutback factors have reduced belowed user
defined levels.
Recommended Action:
Check for temperature or voltage cutback condition and take
appropriate action

Description: One or more configured RPDOs not received with 3s at start up or 500ms during normal operation.
Recommended Action: Check status of all nodes on CANbus. Check PDOs on all CANbus nodes are configured correctly and match up.

Description:
CANbus off fault condition detected on multinode system.
NOTE: This fault was added for Aichi, to replace Very Severe CAN off fault
Data missing from CAN (Renault only)
Recommended Action:
Check connection to CANbus, ensure all devices on bus are
communicating.

Description: EMCY message received from non-Sevcon node and anonymous EMCY level (0x2830,0) is set to 2.
Recommended Action: Check status of non-Sevcon nodes on CANbus

Description:
Number of slaves (0x2810,0) set higher than maximum allowed
number of slaves
Time to close breaker of GpAC has expired
Recommended Action: Cycle power and restart breaker close sequence

Description: Motor isolation contactor is open circuit
Motor terminal is open circuit or disconnected from controller
Recommended Action: Check motor wiring. Check controller condition

Description: No speed feedback from motor
Recommended Action: Check encoder wiring and speed measurement signal

Description: Battery voltage has dropped below critical level
One or more configured RPDOs not received with 3s at start up or 500ms during normal operation.
Recommended Action: Check status of all nodes on CANbus. Check PDOs on all CANbus nodes are configured correctly and match up.

Description: CANopen slave has changed to unexpected state
Recommended Action: Check status of all nodes on CANbus.

Description:
EEPROM or flash configuration data corrupted and data can not be
recovered.
VPDO mapped to non-existent or invalid object
At least one configuration object is out of range
Recommended Action: Set configuration object to valid value. Our of range object can be identified using 0x5621 or Engineering DVT CLI window.

Description:
At least one configuration object is out of dynamic range. This is
where one objects range depends on another object.
Recommended Action:
Check all dynamic range objects. Engineering DVT CLI window
indicates type of object which is out of range.

Description: Unable to automatically configure I/O and vehicle setup.
Unable to set battery voltage
Recommended Action: Check auxillary drives support low voltage configurations

Description: Steering switches are in an invalid state
Line contactor did not close when coil is energized.
Line contactor closed when coil is denergized.
Unable to change between traction and pump motors on beltloader.
Recommended Action: Check change over contactors and motor wiring.

Description: Fault signalled by Renault vehicle network
VERLOG signal failure
Digital input wire-off
Analogue input outside of allowed range (0x46cX)
Contactor driver over current
Recommended Action:
Ensure contactor doesn't exceed maximum current and check
contactor wiring

Message: Analogue Output On with No Failsafe
Description: Internal hardware failsafe circuitry not working
Contactor driver not working
Contactor driver over temperature

Description: Contactor driver unable to achieve current target in current mode
Recommended Action: Ensure contactor driver current target is within range

Capacitor voltage (0x5100,3) did not rise above 5V at power up

Motor current exceeded controller rated maximum
Motor controller unable to maintain control of motor
Recommended Action: Check motor configuration. Ensure motor speed is not too high.

Description: Motor control tripped due to motor overspeed
Recommended Action: Check motor configuration. Ensure motor speed is not too high.

Description: Encoder is not aligned properly.
Recommended Action: Ensure encoder offset is correctly set or re-align encoder
